abstract: AT&T’s chief executive said that his biggest problem was not renewed competition from the likes of Sprint Nextel. Instead, he is focused on the need to improve the company’s network and the uncertainty over the country’s fiscal future
snippet: AT&T’s chief executive said that his biggest problem was not renewed competition from the likes of Sprint Nextel. Instead, he is focused on the need to improve the company’s network and the uncertainty over the country’s fiscal future
lead_paragraph: With two potential mergers that could strengthen long-lagging competitors — AT&T is under pressure to respond.

headline.main: AT&T’s Biggest Problems Aren’t Emboldened Rivals, Chief Says

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
